newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish man shot dead in apparent guerrilla attack.
newsitem.headline: Spanish man shot dead in apparent guerrilla attack.

text.p: A man was shot in the head and killed in northern Spain on Thursday in what a government official said was clearly a guerrilla attack.
Spanish police said the man received a single shot in the forehead at close range and later died in hospital.
"It is clear that is was an terrorist attack," said local authority official Roman Sudupe.
A Basque government spokesman confirmed the victim had not been a member of the security forces, a common target for Basque separatist group ETA (Basque Homeland and Freedom).
The 39-year-old victim was a bicycle salesman, married with two children, who police described as a "normal citizen".
Police could not confirm whether the attack was in fact the work of ETA, which has killed some 800 people since 1968 in its campaign for an independent Basque state.
An ETA woman guerrilla shot in the head and killed an army officer earlier in January, marking the first separatist assassination this year, government officials said.
